question: First Batch (2024-08-05) - Dr. Sina - Question 1 All of the following nerves passing from common tendinous ring, Except:
explanation: The trochlear nerve passes outside the common tendinous ring, while the other listed nerves pass through it.

question: First Batch (2024-08-05) - Dr. Sina - Question 2 All of the following structures are related to the vascular layer of the eyeball EXCEPT:
explanation: The sclera is part of the fibrous layer of the eyeball, not the vascular layer.

question: First Batch (2024-08-05) - Dr. Sina - Question 3 Sphincter pupillae can .................. pupil and is innervated by ............... nerve.
explanation: The sphincter pupillae muscle constricts the pupil and is supplied by parasympathetic fibers.

question: First Batch (2024-08-05) - Dr. Sina - Question 4 Highest visual sensitivity in retina is .........
explanation: The fovea centralis is the area with the highest visual sensitivity and is rich in cones.

question: First Batch (2024-08-05) - Dr. Sina - Question 5 All of the following sensory nerves supply the skin of the auricle EXCEPT:
explanation: The auricle is supplied by branches of the vagus, facial, and great auricular nerves, but not primarily by the trigeminal nerve.

question: First Batch (2024-08-05) - Dr. Sina - Question 6 Sensory innervation of the mucous membrane on the inner surface of the tympanic membrane is .............. .
explanation: The glossopharyngeal nerve supplies the inner surface of the tympanic membrane.

question: First Batch (2024-08-05) - Dr. Sina - Question 7 Floor of the middle ear separates it from which structure?
explanation: The floor of the middle ear is related to the jugular vein (jugular bulb).

question: First Batch (2024-08-05) - Dr. Sina - Question 8 Which nerve goes out from the anterior wall of the tympanic cavity?
explanation: The chorda tympani nerve exits through the anterior wall of the tympanic cavity.

question: First Batch (2024-08-05) - Dr. Sina - Question 9 Tensor tympani muscle is innervated by ..........
explanation: The tensor tympani is supplied by the mandibular nerve (V3).

question: First Batch (2024-08-05) - Dr. Sina - Question 10 Bony labyrinth consists of all the following parts EXCEPT:
explanation: The saccule is part of the membranous labyrinth, not the bony labyrinth.

question: First Batch (2024-08-05) - Dr. Sina - Question 11 What is the innervation of the levator palpebrae superioris muscle?
explanation: The levator palpebrae superioris is innervated by the oculomotor nerve (CN III).

question: First Batch (2024-08-05) - Dr. Sina - Question 12 All of the following structures pass from the internal acoustic meatus EXCEPT:
explanation: The chorda tympani does not pass through the internal acoustic meatus; it branches from the facial nerve later.

question: First Batch (2024-08-05) - Dr. Sina - Question 13 Eustachian tube opens in which wall of the tympanic cavity?
explanation: The Eustachian tube opens into the anterior wall of the tympanic cavity.

question: First Batch (2024-08-05) - Dr. Sina - Question 14 All of the following structures can be seen in the medial wall of the tympanic cavity EXCEPT:
explanation: The pyramidal eminence is located on the posterior wall of the tympanic cavity.

question: First Batch (2024-08-05) - Dr. Sina - Question 15 Anterior lacrimal crest is located in ..........
explanation: The anterior lacrimal crest is part of the maxillary bone.

question: First Batch (2024-08-05) - Dr. Sina - Question 16 Which nerve stimulates the secretion of the lacrimal gland?
options: Greater petrosal nerve from facial nerve
Greater petrosal nerve from trigeminal nerve
answerText: Greater petrosal nerve from facial nerve
explanation: The greater petrosal nerve is a branch of the facial nerve, carrying parasympathetic fibers to the lacrimal gland.

question: First Batch (2024-08-05) - Dr. Sina - Question 17 Which nerve passes from the inside of the cavernous sinus?
explanation: The abducent nerve passes through the cavernous sinus, while the others lie in its lateral wall.

question: First Batch (2024-08-05) - Dr. Sina - Question 18 In which disease does the opacity of the lens increase?
explanation: Cataracts are characterized by the opacity of the lens, leading to reduced vision.

question: First Batch (2024-09-29) Retake Exam - Dr. Sina - Question 1 What is the innervation of the levator palpebrae superioris muscle?
explanation: The levator palpebrae superioris muscle is innervated by the oculomotor nerve (CN III).

question: First Batch (2024-09-29) Retake Exam - Dr. Sina - Question 2 All of the following nerves pass from the common tendinous ring, Except:
explanation: The trochlear nerve does not pass through the common tendinous ring; it enters the orbit outside of it.

question: First Batch (2024-09-29) Retake Exam - Dr. Sina - Question 3 Which nerve passes from the inside of the cavernous sinus?
explanation: The abducent nerve (CN VI) runs within the cavernous sinus alongside the internal carotid artery.

question: First Batch (2024-09-29) Retake Exam - Dr. Sina - Question 4 Sphincter pupillae can .................. pupil and is innervated by ............... nerve.
explanation: The sphincter pupillae constricts the pupil and is innervated by parasympathetic fibers from the oculomotor nerve.

question: First Batch (2024-09-29) Retake Exam - Dr. Sina - Question 5 Highest visual sensitivity in retina is ..........
explanation: The fovea centralis is the area of the retina with the highest visual sensitivity and sharpest vision.

question: First Batch (2024-09-29) Retake Exam - Dr. Sina - Question 6 In which disease does the opacity of the lens increase?
explanation: Cataracts are characterized by an increase in the opacity of the lens.

question: First Batch (2024-09-29) Retake Exam - Dr. Sina - Question 7 The floor of the middle ear separates it from which structure?
explanation: The floor of the middle ear separates it from the jugular vein.

question: First Batch (2024-09-29) Retake Exam - Dr. Sina - Question 8 The bony labyrinth consists of all the following parts EXCEPT:
explanation: The bony labyrinth consists of the cochlea, vestibule, and semicircular canals. The saccule is part of the membranous labyrinth.

question: First Batch (2024-09-29) Retake Exam - Dr. Sina - Question 9 The Eustachian tube opens in which wall of the tympanic cavity?
explanation: The Eustachian tube opens into the anterior wall of the tympanic cavity.

question: First Batch (2024-09-29) Retake Exam - Dr. Sina - Question 10 Sensory innervation of the mucous membrane on the inner surface of the tympanic membrane is ..............
explanation: The inner surface of the tympanic membrane is supplied by the glossopharyngeal nerve (CN IX).
